meanings.sent1: She decided to regrant the permission to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The organization will regrant the funds to support the project.
meanings.sent3: After realizing the mistake, he had to regrant access to the system.
meanings.sent4: The teacher regranting extra credit opportunities made the students very happy.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to regrant wishes with a wave.

meanings.definition: The act of giving a grant for a second time.
meanings.sent1: The regranting of scholarships helped many students continue their education.
meanings.sent2: The regranting process required careful documentation and review.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected regranting of the award caused a lot of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The regranting ceremony was a formal event attended by many dignitaries.
meanings.sent5: The regranting policy aimed to support innovative projects in the community.
